text.title: Don Julio: A Meat Lover's Paradise in the Heart of Buenos Aires—Eat. Stay. Love
text.p: [Music]
wenos seris is a food lovers Paradise if
you come to Argentina the two things
that people have to do are drink some
malach wine and eat a
[Music]
steak if you come to Buenos Aris palmo
should be on your list of must visit
neighborhoods it's filled with cafes
restaurants bars and shops and it's home
to some of the best Pras in town Prisha
are restaurants that specialize in
Argentine barbecue including my personal
meet Mecca Don Julio when you come to a
place like Don Julio you know it's going
to be good and it's just a pleasure to
eat and it's also a great place for
people to get an inside look into
Argentine culture you feel that they
take the same care that you take at home
to make parisha Don Julio has been the
reigning parisha in poo for 15 years PA
welcomes me with open arms which is
super special it's like this meat
Paradise in the middle of the capital of
meat good to have lunch here yes and a
good glass of
[Music]
wine salute my friends food my
friends the first time I came here was
10 years ago it was one of the first
Paras when you can have a good wine now
it's a classic still has the sense of
palmo sense of the neighborhood it's
like you're in the heart of palmo it's
cool it's hipster now but it's still the
kind of Parish that you you mentioned
yeah I was shocked to learn that a
standard in Argentina is to cook beef
well done unless you emphasize you want
it done differently so how do you
usually order your steak well done well
he kills it you can it well done I
became friends with Daniela a few years
ago she was working on an article about
a vegetarian versus a me eater and I was
the me eater she was a
vegetarian argentines eat all parts of
the cow and typically a meal might begin
with t moas sweet breads I can't believe
there was one day that I didn't like
these I can believe people who don't eat
MOA every time I came here I like to
have the Empanada it's incredibly
good I love the Empanada from you came
here toio and like the start you ask
carne and then you have like carne and
then you have carne you have like meat
BL meat loose meat after meat meat and
tereso is like it's like my little
sister my little brother I have to she
even said today like she forgot that she
was even a vegetarian before because
this tastes so good like how could she
has spent so long not eating
this Pablo is particularly proud of his
provoleta one of the few non-meat
appetizers it's essentially a slab of
provolone cheese that's grilled and
sometimes topped with spices it's not
enough with a banana you have like the
cheese after the meat is not what a
nutritionist like
recommend I love the whole like act of
Ino like of having a barbecue the most
sheas the kidneys the chiso you have the
second course which is just like all the
meats the key to ordering steak at a
peria is understanding the different
cuts of beef AIA offers specialty cuts
of beef that are not often seen in the
US from heart to tongue to
tail you'll soon understand the old
adage the only part of a cow in
Argentine doesn't eat is the
moo always way with chimi and a always
with salsa this is great this is me and
meat fat meat fat wow I love those PTO
the traditional Paras need to have their
owners it's part of the soul of what the
baras are this is actually the 15th year
of Don Julio Pablo started it when he
was like a kid like he was in his 20s
his family were butchers and they had a
farm out outside of Buenos SES and he
started as a place in the neighborhood
just like to bring great food with that
local feel but still a really high
quality perfect
one of the best things that I love about
Don Julio the waiter will come with a
marker and they'll have the customer
sign the bottle of wine and then they
put it up to display and they do that
with every single table and I just think
that's super special to create the sense
of community of people that who have
dined it down Julio from all over the
world and to kind of put their Mark like
yeah we drink that bottle of wine and
put that on the wall your life it's in
one place you know it's not the place
it's the soul of the place this place
has Soul a lot of times the Julio was
part of perfect days I
have well amig am it was a great lunch
yeah good cheers cheers I'm never
leaving Argentina ever
[Music]
